text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus humicola is a species of mushroom in the Cortinariaceae family.
text.Description: The cap is 1 to 5 centimetres (0.4 to 2.0 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Gymnopilus humicola grows on humus, in coniferous and deciduous woods. It has been found in Michigan, Idaho, Tennessee, and Washington. It fruits from June to September.
